title: The Descendants of Esau
summary: Genesis 36 details the genealogy of Esau, also called Edom. It lists his wives, sons, and chiefs of his descendants. This chapter establishes the nation of Edom, which will later interact with Israel.

faq.question: Why is Esau’s genealogy important?
faq.answer: It shows the development of the Edomite nation and fulfills God’s promise that Esau would become a great people.
